description.plain:
Years & Years is the solo project of English singer Olly Alexander. Until 2021, it was a London-based electro-pop trio, comprising Olly, Mikey Goldsworthy and Emre Türkmen. The group originally formed as a quintet in 2010, after Mikey had moved from Australia and had met Emre. Founding members Olivier Subria and Noel Leeman left the band in 2013. Shortly afterwards, Olly became the group’s frontman, after Mikey had heard him singing in the shower and invited him to join Years & Years.

Their first EP, Traps, was released in 2013. They followed up with three more EP’s, Real, Take Shelter, and Y&Y, in 2014 and 2015. Their first full-length album, Communion, was released on July 10, 2015.

In April of 2018, Years & Years began to tease fans with talks of a new record via Facebook word games and their official newsletter, hinting the album would drop by the “seventh third quarter moon,” which fell on July 6, 2018. “Sanctify” and “If You’re Over Me” were the two lead singles that led to the eventual release of the band’s sophomore album, Palo Santo.

In March 2021, Olly announced that Years & Years would become his own solo project, though both Mikey (who remained a back-up musician at live concerts) and Emre (who focused on songwriting) would keep being involved in the group in some capacities.

“Starstruck,” released in April 2021, became Years & Years' first single since the split, whereas Alexander released the third album from the project, Night Call, in January 2022.

Years & Years is the solo project of English singer Olly Alexander. Until 2021, it was a London-based electro-pop trio, comprising Olly, Mikey Goldsworthy and Emre Türkmen. The group originally formed as a quintet in 2010, after Mikey had moved from Australia and had met Emre. Founding members Olivier Subria and Noel Leeman left the band in 2013. Shortly afterwards, Olly became the group’s frontman, after Mikey had heard him singing in the shower and invited him to join Years & Years.

Their first EP, Traps, was released in 2013. They followed up with three more EP’s, Real, Take Shelter, and Y&Y, in 2014 and 2015. Their first full-length album, Communion, was released on July 10, 2015.

In April of 2018, Years & Years began to tease fans with talks of a new record via Facebook word games and their official newsletter, hinting the album would drop by the “seventh third quarter moon,” which fell on July 6, 2018. “Sanctify” and “If You’re Over Me” were the two lead singles that led to the eventual release of the band’s sophomore album, Palo Santo.

In March 2021, Olly announced that Years & Years would become his own solo project, though both Mikey (who remained a back-up musician at live concerts) and Emre (who focused on songwriting) would keep being involved in the group in some capacities.

“Starstruck,” released in April 2021, became Years & Years' first single since the split, whereas Alexander released the third album from the project, Night Call, in January 2022.

songs.title: King

description.plain:
“King” is the fourth single from Years & Years debut studio album, Communion, originally appearing on their extended play Y & Y. It reached the #1 spot on the UK Singles Chart on March 8th, 2015.

In a comment on Youtube, the trio explained the meaning of the song as being about “feeling controlled by somebody and wanting them to let you go.”

In an interview with Shazam, frontman Olly Alexander said that the track “feels like a mixture of different parts” of his life:

Lyrically, it was written at two different stages in my life. First of all, when I was in a relationship and I was really frustrated [because] I went out with the same types of person all the time and I really wanted that to stop. And then I rewrite it again later, because I was in a relationship that I wanted to end.

Although the narrator in this song has sacrificed a lot to be with this person just to feel like a king, he wants this relationship to come to an end due to its destructive nature. He wants to feel like his lover does not control him anymore, and so he insists on breaking himself down, fighting with his lover, and then moving on.

songs.embed_content: Read “King” by Years & Years on Genius

“King” is the fourth single from Years & Years debut studio album, Communion, originally appearing on their extended play Y & Y. It reached the #1 spot on the UK Singles Chart on March 8th, 2015.

In a comment on Youtube, the trio explained the meaning of the song as being about “feeling controlled by somebody and wanting them to let you go.”

In an interview with Shazam, frontman Olly Alexander said that the track “feels like a mixture of different parts” of his life:

Lyrically, it was written at two different stages in my life. First of all, when I was in a relationship and I was really frustrated [because] I went out with the same types of person all the time and I really wanted that to stop. And then I rewrite it again later, because I was in a relationship that I wanted to end.

Although the narrator in this song has sacrificed a lot to be with this person just to feel like a king, he wants this relationship to come to an end due to its destructive nature. He wants to feel like his lover does not control him anymore, and so he insists on breaking himself down, fighting with his lover, and then moving on.

songs.lyrics:
37 ContributorsKing Lyrics[Verse 1]
I caught you watching me under the light
Can I realign?
They say it’s easy to leave you behind
I don’t wanna try

[Pre-Chorus]
Cut cover, take that test
Hold courage to your chest
Don’t wanna wait for you
Don’t wanna have to lose all that I've compromised
To feel another high
I’ve got to keep it down tonight
[Chorus]
And, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
I was a king under your control
And, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
I wanna feel like you've let me go
So let me go

[Verse 2]
Don’t you remember how I used to like being on the line?
I dreamed you dreamed of me calling out my name
Is it worth the price?

[Pre-Chorus]
Cut cover, take that test
Hold courage to your chest
Don’t wanna wait for you
Don’t wanna have to lose all that I've compromised
To feel another high
I’ve got to keep it down tonight

[Chorus]
And, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
I was a king under your control
And, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
I wanna feel like you've let me go
You might also like[Bridge]
I had to break myself to carry on
No love and no admission
Take this from me tonight
Oh-oh, let's fight
Oh-oh-oh, let's fight
Oh-oh, let's fight
Oh-oh-oh

[Chorus]
And, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
I was a king under your control
And, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
I wanna feel like you’ve let me go
So let me go

[Outro]
Let go, let go, let go of everything
Let go, let go, let go of everything
Let go, let go, let go of everything
Let go, let go, let go of everything78Embed

songs.title: Breathe

description.plain: This is a cover of Blu Cantrell’s song “Breathe” featuring Sean Paul. It serves as the B-side to “Take Shelter” from the trio’s EP of the same name, and was later selected as a track for their album Communion.

songs.embed_content: Read “Breathe” by Years & Years on Genius

songs.title: Shine

description.plain:
“Shine” is the fifth single from Years & Years‘ debut album Communion, first released on the 5th of July 2015.

It is an unusual addition to the album in that the song describes an uncharacteristically positive relationship in the singer’s life. This relationship of course involves Olly and Clean Bandit violinist Neil Milan Amin-Smith.

songs.embed_content: Read “Shine” by Years & Years on Genius

songs.title: This Is Heaven

songs.lyrics:
28 ContributorsShine Lyrics[Verse 1]
I remember us alone
Waiting for the light to go
Don't you feel that hunger?
I've got so many secrets to show
When I saw you on that stage
I shivered with the look you gave
Don't you hear that rhythm?
Can you show me how we can escape?

I was biting my tongue, I was trying to hide

I'll forget what I've done, I will be redefined
[Chorus]

I'll recover if you keep me alight
Don't leave me behind
Can you see me? I'm shining
And it's you that I've been waiting to find
